title: Mark Finchem
added: ==2021 storming of the United States Capitol==

Finchem traveled to Washington, D.C. to take part in the January 6, 2021 protests of the 2020 presidential election results, claiming "substantial evidence that this election was a fraud" and tweeted pictures of the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|protestors massed on the steps of the Capitol building]].<ref name="KNXV">{{cite news |last1=Waltz |first1=Adam |title=Seven Arizonan Republican legislators face calls to ban them from the House and Senate |url=https://www.abc15.com/news/state/seven-arizonan-republican-legislators-face-calls-to-ban-them-from-the-house-and-senate |access-date=January 9, 2021 |work=[[KNXV]] |date=January 8, 2021 |language=en}}</ref> Finchem later claimed that leftists had instigated the violence.<ref name="AzRep">{{cite news |last1=Oxford |first1=Andrew |title=Among some in Arizona GOP, siege of the US Capitol was everyone's fault except Trump |url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/07/these-arizona-republicans-say-trump-isnt-to-blame-for-capitol-riot/6580354002/ |access-date=January 9, 2021 |work=The Arizona Republic |date=January 7, 2021}}</ref> A coalition of community organizations subsequently called for the expulsion from Arizona's legislature of Finchem  and six other Republican lawmakers who publicly advocated overturning the 2020 election results.<ref name="KNXV" /><ref name="KTAR">{{cite news |title=Organizations call for expulsion of several Arizona GOP lawmakers |url=https://ktar.com/story/3819527/organizations-call-for-expulsion-of-several-arizona-gop-lawmakers/ |access-date=January 9, 2021 |work=[[KTAR-FM]] |date=January 8, 2021}}</ref>
